trans-unit.source: Integrating Azure Active Directory with applications getting started guide | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Integrating Azure Active Directory with applications getting started guide | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: This article is a getting started guide for integrating Azure Active Directory (AD) with on-premises applications, and cloud applications.
trans-unit.target: This article is a getting started guide for integrating Azure Active Directory (AD) with on-premises applications, and cloud applications.

trans-unit.source: Integrating Azure Active Directory with applications getting started guide
trans-unit.target: Integrating Azure Active Directory with applications getting started guide

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: This topic is intended to give you a roadmap for integrating applications with Azure Active Directory (AD).
trans-unit.target: This topic is intended to give you a roadmap for integrating applications with Azure Active Directory (AD).

trans-unit.source: Each of the sections below contain a brief summary of a more detailed topic so you can identify which parts of this getting started guide are relevant to you.
trans-unit.target: Each of the sections below contain a brief summary of a more detailed topic so you can identify which parts of this getting started guide are relevant to you.

trans-unit.source: Follow the links for a deeper dive on each subject.
trans-unit.target: Follow the links for a deeper dive on each subject.

trans-unit.source: Before you begin, take inventory
trans-unit.target: Before you begin, take inventory

trans-unit.source: Before you jump in to integrating applications with Azure AD, it is important to know where you are and where you want to go.
trans-unit.target: Before you jump in to integrating applications with Azure AD, it is important to know where you are and where you want to go.

trans-unit.source: The following questions are intended to help you think about your Azure AD application integration project.
trans-unit.target: The following questions are intended to help you think about your Azure AD application integration project.

trans-unit.source: Application inventory
trans-unit.target: Application inventory

trans-unit.source: Where are all of your applications?
trans-unit.target: Where are all of your applications?

trans-unit.source: Who owns them?
trans-unit.target: Who owns them?

trans-unit.source: What kind of authentication do your applications require?
trans-unit.target: What kind of authentication do your applications require?

trans-unit.source: Who needs access to which applications?
trans-unit.target: Who needs access to which applications?

trans-unit.source: Do you want to deploy a new application?
trans-unit.target: Do you want to deploy a new application?

trans-unit.source: Will you build it in-house and deploy it on an Azure compute instance?
trans-unit.target: Will you build it in-house and deploy it on an Azure compute instance?

trans-unit.source: Will you use one that is available in the Azure Application Gallery?
trans-unit.target: Will you use one that is available in the Azure Application Gallery?

trans-unit.source: User and group inventory
trans-unit.target: User and group inventory

trans-unit.source: Where do your user accounts reside?
trans-unit.target: Where do your user accounts reside?

trans-unit.source: On-premises Active Directory
trans-unit.target: On-premises Active Directory

trans-unit.source: Azure AD
trans-unit.target: Azure AD

trans-unit.source: Within a separate application database that you own
trans-unit.target: Within a separate application database that you own

trans-unit.source: In unsanctioned applications
trans-unit.target: In unsanctioned applications

trans-unit.source: All of the above
trans-unit.target: All of the above

trans-unit.source: What permissions and role assignments do individual users currently have?
trans-unit.target: What permissions and role assignments do individual users currently have?

trans-unit.source: Do you need to review their access or are you sure that your user access and role assignments are appropriate now?
trans-unit.target: Do you need to review their access or are you sure that your user access and role assignments are appropriate now?

trans-unit.source: Are groups already established in your on-premises Active Directory?
trans-unit.target: Are groups already established in your on-premises Active Directory?

trans-unit.source: How are your groups organized?
trans-unit.target: How are your groups organized?

trans-unit.source: Who are the group members?
trans-unit.target: Who are the group members?

trans-unit.source: What permissions/role assignments do the groups currently have?
trans-unit.target: What permissions/role assignments do the groups currently have?

trans-unit.source: Will you need to clean up user/group databases before integrating?
trans-unit.target: Will you need to clean up user/group databases before integrating?

trans-unit.source: (This is a pretty important question.
trans-unit.target: (This is a pretty important question.

trans-unit.source: Garbage in, garbage out.)
trans-unit.target: Garbage in, garbage out.)

trans-unit.source: Access management inventory
trans-unit.target: Access management inventory

trans-unit.source: How do you currently manage user access to applications?
trans-unit.target: How do you currently manage user access to applications?

trans-unit.source: Does that need to change?
trans-unit.target: Does that need to change?

trans-unit.source: Have you considered other ways to manage access, such as with [RBAC](role-based-access-control-configure.md) for example?
trans-unit.target: Have you considered other ways to manage access, such as with [RBAC](role-based-access-control-configure.md) for example?

trans-unit.source: Who needs access to what?
trans-unit.target: Who needs access to what?

trans-unit.source: Maybe you don't have the answers to all of these questions up front but that's okay.
trans-unit.target: Maybe you don't have the answers to all of these questions up front but that's okay.

trans-unit.source: This guide can help you answer some of those questions and make some informed decisions.
trans-unit.target: This guide can help you answer some of those questions and make some informed decisions.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: An Azure subscription and an Azure Active Directory directory.
trans-unit.target: An Azure subscription and an Azure Active Directory directory.

trans-unit.source: If you don't already have an Azure subscription, you can try out Azure for free for 30 days.
trans-unit.target: If you don't already have an Azure subscription, you can try out Azure for free for 30 days.

trans-unit.source: Try it out!
trans-unit.target: Try it out!

trans-unit.source: Application integration with Azure AD
trans-unit.target: Application integration with Azure AD

trans-unit.source: Finding unsanctioned cloud applications with Cloud App Discovery
trans-unit.target: Finding unsanctioned cloud applications with Cloud App Discovery

trans-unit.source: As mentioned above, there may be applications that haven't been managed by your organization until now.
trans-unit.target: As mentioned above, there may be applications that haven't been managed by your organization until now.

trans-unit.source: As part of the inventory process, it is possible to find unsanctioned cloud applications.
trans-unit.target: As part of the inventory process, it is possible to find unsanctioned cloud applications.

trans-unit.source: See
trans-unit.target: See

trans-unit.source: [Finding unsanctioned cloud applications with Cloud App Discovery](active-directory-cloudappdiscovery-whatis.md).
trans-unit.target: [Finding unsanctioned cloud applications with Cloud App Discovery](active-directory-cloudappdiscovery-whatis.md).

trans-unit.source: Authentication Types
trans-unit.target: Authentication Types

trans-unit.source: Each of your applications may have different authentication requirements.
trans-unit.target: Each of your applications may have different authentication requirements.

trans-unit.source: With Azure AD, signing certificates can be used with applications that use SAML 2.0, WS-Federation, or OpenID Connect Protocols as well as Password Single Sign On.
trans-unit.target: With Azure AD, signing certificates can be used with applications that use SAML 2.0, WS-Federation, or OpenID Connect Protocols as well as Password Single Sign On.

trans-unit.source: For more information about application authentication types for use with Azure AD see [Managing Certificates for Federated Single Sign-On in Azure Active Directory](active-directory-sso-certs.md) and [Password based single sign on](active-directory-appssoaccess-whatis.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about application authentication types for use with Azure AD see [Managing Certificates for Federated Single Sign-On in Azure Active Directory](active-directory-sso-certs.md) and [Password based single sign on](active-directory-appssoaccess-whatis.md).

trans-unit.source: Enabling SSO with Azure AD App Proxy
trans-unit.target: Enabling SSO with Azure AD App Proxy

trans-unit.source: With Microsoft Azure AD Application Proxy, you can provide access to applications located inside your private network securely, from anywhere and on any device.
trans-unit.target: With Microsoft Azure AD Application Proxy, you can provide access to applications located inside your private network securely, from anywhere and on any device.

trans-unit.source: After you have installed an application proxy connector within your environment, it can be easily configured with Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: After you have installed an application proxy connector within your environment, it can be easily configured with Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: See [Enabling SSO with Azure AD App Proxy](active-directory-appssoaccess-enable-hybrid-access.md) and [Publishing new applications with Azure AD App Proxy](active-directory-application-proxy-configure.md).
trans-unit.target: See [Enabling SSO with Azure AD App Proxy](active-directory-appssoaccess-enable-hybrid-access.md) and [Publishing new applications with Azure AD App Proxy](active-directory-application-proxy-configure.md).

trans-unit.target: Managing access to applications

trans-unit.target: The following articles describe ways you can manage access to applications once they have been integrated with Azure AD using Azure AD Connectors and Azure AD in the Azure portal.

trans-unit.target: [Assigning users to an application](active-directory-applications-guiding-developers-assigning-users.md) with the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: Integrating custom applications
trans-unit.target: Integrating custom applications

trans-unit.source: If you are writing a new application and want to assist developers in leveraging the power Azure AD, see [Guiding developers](active-directory-applications-guiding-developers-for-lob-applications.md).
trans-unit.target: If you are writing a new application and want to assist developers in leveraging the power Azure AD, see [Guiding developers](active-directory-applications-guiding-developers-for-lob-applications.md).

trans-unit.source: If you want to add your custom application to the Azure Application Gallery, see [“Bring your own app” with Azure AD Self-Service SAML configuration](http://blogs.technet.com/b/ad/archive/2015/06/17/bring-your-own-app-with-azure-ad-self-service-saml-configuration-gt-now-in-preview.aspx).
trans-unit.target: If you want to add your custom application to the Azure Application Gallery, see [“Bring your own app” with Azure AD Self-Service SAML configuration](http://blogs.technet.com/b/ad/archive/2015/06/17/bring-your-own-app-with-azure-ad-self-service-saml-configuration-gt-now-in-preview.aspx).
